data.text: Generators

Is possible configure in wich worlds you want spawn the generators. The "Blacklist" boolean option is for choice the "Whitelist" or the "Blacklist", and the "List" is for write what world you want or not want.
In this section you can configure all aspects of the Generators.
The default configuration create 4 generators of Normal Type, but here you can change this configuration.
There is no limit of creation! You can duplicate the entire section of a single generator and create your own generator.
If you want more details on how configure your own generator scroll below.
Size Configuration
In this section you can configure the <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Size </font>of generator.
The "<font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Size</font>" and the "<font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">3x3</font>" write in the config are not the same!

items.content: Size: identify the size of the generator when is placed without considering the frame;
3x3: is the identifier of the generator, you can change it with all you want;

data.text: The Size configuration works in this way NxM where:

items.content: N is a number from 1 to infinte;
M is a number from 1 to infinte;

data.text: I know where is your question:

items.content: Is possible configure a 1x1 generator? Yes
Is possible configure a 2x2 generator? Yes, but the creation is a little strange because is a even number;
Is possible configure a 2x3 generator? Yes, but the creation is a little strange because there is a even number;
Is possible configure a 3x5 generator? Yes
Is possible configure a 240x240? Yes, but the wait time is exponential! You must consider the plugin check every location before place the block.

data.text: 240 x 240 x 240 + frame blocks with 0,1 milliseconds for block = 1.382.400 milliseconds.
1.382.400 milliseconds -> 1.382,4 seconds -> 23,04 minutes. I sure you understood.
Generator Item
In this sections you can configure all aspects of <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Generator Item</font>:

items.content: Name: is the name appears on item. TIP. Use the configuration name here for remember;
Type: is the type of item. If you use a PLAYER_HEAD you can set also a Texture, otherwise the texture has not applied;

Lore: is the lore of item, contains various informations of a generator. The presence of informations depends on what type of generator you chose. For example a Normal Generator have only {level} placeholder;
CustomModelData: is the model data for create custom resource pack;

data.text: Generator Types
In this section you can configure the <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Generator Type</font>, there are 3 types of generator:

items.content: Normal Generator: Is the default configuration of the generator. This type use blocks and a level system for upgrade more then one features at time. For configure the Normal Generator you can use generators.yml file, CustomUpgrade section to false and GeneratorType section to "BlockGenerator";

data.text: Generator File Configuration

items.content: Custom Generator: This type use blocks and a level system for upgrade only one feature at time. For configure the Custom Generator you can use customUpgrade.yml file, CustomUpgrade section to true and GeneratorType section to "BlockGenerator";

data.text: Custom Upgrade File Configuration

items.content: Mob Generator: This type use mobs and a level system for upgrade more then one features at time. For configure the Mob Generator you can use mobGenerator.yml file, CustomUpgrade section to false and GeneratorType section to "MobGenerator";

data.text: Mob Generator File Configuration
Crafting
In this section you can configure a crafting for the Generator Item.
First of all you must enable it if you want use with <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Enabled: true</font>, then you can configure the Recipe.
The Recipe is a 3x3 crafting table represented by 3 lines and 3 columns, for example the first column and the first line contains the letter "c".
For each letter you can define a material in the Items list.

data.message: P.S. Pay attention at the crafting!

data.text: If you use a crafting already exist for Minecraft is possible from certain versions but is a bad idea for the player!
Upgrade Size
In this section you can configure what is the next generator "size".
How you previous notice, you can upgrade the size of generator when reach the last level for a Normal Generator or for Mob Generator. For make this possible you can configure:

items.content: The last level in generators.yml file or mobGenerator.yml file ;
UpgradeSize section to true of config.yml;
Configure what is the next size of generator using here configuration name;

data.message: If you use the default configuration of plugin the only action you can made for make this is active the <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">UpgradeSize </font>section in config.yml.
